content.description:
This is actually a pretty fun problem if you take the time to clean the upper holds off first. 

 Easiest line on the Razor Wall, roughly a direct line up the center. Work up from the start to a two handed jug-pocket. From this, work your way up to a delicate finish (which may be impossible if you don't clean the pine needles off first).Â
content.location: Climbs roughly the center of the wall. Stand start with a sidepull/pinch for your right, and a lower pocket for your left.

content.description:
Stiff mungy climbing on sharp pockets. Feels like sort of a unique boulder for the area, more like limestone or something. 

  Climbing on this wall would be greatly improved by more traffic.  As it is now, I would very strongly recommend walking around to the top and dusting all the pine needles off the upper part of the wall, and digging out the finishing holds before climbing. Would also recommend excavating spiderwebs and dirt from all the pockets you can reach from the ground.
